intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. microdolichaetum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellowish to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry grasslands and rocky soils, preferring full sun exposure. It has small, elongated leaves and produces a cluster of small, dandelion-like flowers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
